sourceMeaningMnemonic: Put an <radical>axe</radical> in your <radical>mouth</radical> with your <radical>fingers</radical> to express your <kanji>philosophy</kanji>. Your philosophy of putting weapons in your mouth. Everyone else seems to think it's a stupid philosophy, so you're showing them that it's not with actions!
meaningInfo: Imagine expressing your philosophy, your deepest thoughts and beliefs, by putting it in your mouth.
readingMnemonic: Your <kanji>philosophy</kanji> on weapons in mouths means you're always tasting <ja><reading>鉄</reading></ja> (<ja>てつ</ja>). They say blood tastes like copper, well weapons taste like iron.
readingInfo: Your philosophy and your way of life means everything tastes like <ja>鉄</ja> now, and you think everyone should be that way.
